sentence.Network_en: His opposition acted as a goad to her determination to succeed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的反对反而刺激她坚定了取得成功的决心。

sentence.Network_en: He wondered if the psychiatrist was trying to goad him into some unguarded response.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怀疑那位精神科医生试图刺激他作出一些本能的反应。

sentence.Network_en: Ellie uses wit as a goad to try to force people to see what is in front of them.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃莉运用自己的机智风趣启发人们，努力使他们看清眼前的东西。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 综合英语单词表(第二册下) - 豆丁网 ... gladly ad. 高兴地，乐意地 goad v. 促使，驱使 gracious a. 殷勤的.
goa 西藏羚羊goad 刺激物goaf 废矿
译网情深 - 打印文章 - ... PMF 项目管理服务 goad 激励，唆使，煽动 a plethora of 过剩的，多血的.
暗黑II代码对照表 - 帝睥流芒的日志 - 网易博客 ... QUILL / 羽 GOAD / 刺棒 BRANCH / 枝.

list.abs: A slight goad or incentive ; a small stimulus ., 刺激小刺激或激励 ; 小刺激.
Hunger had goaded the woman on to steal the food ., 饥饿迫使这个妇女偷食物.
they goaded him on to break the window .他们唆使他打破窗户。
although the innkeeper was warm , we guessed that his real goad was to get more money .尽管客栈老板很热情，但我们猜想他的真正目的是为了得到更多的钱。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gād, of Germanic origin

entry.def: If you goad someone, you deliberately make them feel angry or irritated, often causing them to react by doing something.

example.ex: He wondered if the psychiatrist was trying to goad him into some unguarded response...
example.tran: 他怀疑那位精神科医生试图刺激他作出一些本能的反应。

entry.def: A goad is something that makes someone do a particular thing.

example.ex: Ellie uses wit as a goad to try to force people to see what is in front of them.
example.tran: 埃莉运用自己的机智风趣启发人们，努力使他们看清眼前的东西。

entry.def: A goad is a sharp, pointed stick that is used for driving cattle.

means.word_mean: 1. a pointed instrument used to prod into motion
2. a verbalization that encourages you to attempt something;

sentences.sentence: "the ceaseless prodding got on his nerves"

means.word_mean: 2. urge with or as if with a goad
3. prod or urge as if with a log stick
4. goad or provoke,as by constant criticism;

sentences.sentence: "He needled her with his sarcastic remarks"

auth_sentence.content: But limitations serve as a goad to Thornton.
auth_sentence.res_content: But limitations serve as a goad to Thornton.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But limitations serve as a goad to Thornton.

auth_sentence.content: Poverty was an essential goad to industry.
auth_sentence.res_content: Poverty was an essential goad to industry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Poverty was an essential goad to industry.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps Neal will goad you into rebutting yet another juvenile creationist lie.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perhaps Neal will goad you into rebutting yet another juvenile creationist lie.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps Neal will goad you into rebutting yet another juvenile creationist lie.

sentences.en: to goad someone to do something
They goaded him on to break the window.
The boxers were goaded on by the shrieking crowd.
sentences.cn: 拳击运动员听见观众的喊叫就来劲儿了。
